name: argdist-bpfcc
description: Trace a function and display a summary of its parameter values

pid.description: ID of the process to trace (optional)

string_size.description: Maximum string size to read from char* arguments

duration.description: Total duration of trace, in seconds

verbose.description: Print resulting BPF program code before executing

cumulative.description: Do not clear histograms and freq counts at each interval

top.description: Number of top results to show (not applicable to histograms)

histogram.description: Probe specifier to capture histogram of (see examples below)

count.description: Probe specifier to capture count of (see examples below)

include.description: Additional header files to include in the BPF program

name: bashreadline-bpfcc
description: Print entered bash commands from all running shells

shared.description: Specify the location of libreadline.so library. Default is /lib/libreadline.so

name: biolatency-bpfcc
description: Summarize block device I/O latency as a histogram

queued.description: Include OS queued time in I/O time

milliseconds.description: Millisecond histogram

disks.description: Print a histogram per disk device

flags.description: Print a histogram per set of I/O flags

name: biosnoop-bpfcc
description: Trace block I/O

name: biotop-bpfcc
description: Block device (disk) I/O by process

name: bitesize-bpfcc
description: Command to perform bitesize-bpfcc

location.description: The city and state, e.g. San Francisco, CA

format.description: The temperature unit to use. Infer this from the user's location.

name: bpflist-bpfcc
description: Display processes currently using BPF programs and maps

verbosity.description: Count and display kprobes/uprobes as well

name: btrfsdist-bpfcc
description: Summarize btrfs operation latency

notimestamp.description: Don't include timestamp on interval output

milliseconds.description: Output in milliseconds

name: btrfsslower-bpfcc
description: Trace common btrfs file operations slower than a threshold

min_ms.description: minimum I/O duration to trace, in ms (default 10)

duration.description: total duration of trace in seconds

name: cachestat-bpfcc
description: Count cache kernel function calls

name: cachetop-bpfcc
description: Show Linux page cache hit/miss statistics including read and write hit % per processes in a UI like top.

name: capable-bpfcc
description: Trace security capability checks

verbose.description: Include non-audit checks

extra.description: Show extra fields in TID and INSETID columns

cgroupmap.description: Trace cgroups in this BPF map only

mntnsmap.description: Trace mount namespaces in this BPF map only

unique.description: Don't repeat stacks for the same pid or cgroup

name: cobjnew-bpfcc
description: Summarize object allocations in high-level languages.

interval.description: Print every specified number of seconds

top-count.description: Number of most frequently allocated types to print

top-size.description: Number of largest types by allocated bytes to print

verbose.description: Verbose mode: print the BPF program (for debugging purposes)

name: cpudist-bpfcc
description: Summarize on-CPU time per task as a histogram

milliseconds.description: Millisecond histogram

pids.description: Print a histogram per process ID

tids.description: Print a histogram per thread ID

name: cpuunclaimed-bpfcc
description: Sample CPU run queues and calculate unclaimed idle CPU

csv.description: Print sample summaries (verbose) as comma-separated values

fullcsv.description: Print sample summaries with extra fields: CPU sample offsets

name: criticalstat-bpfcc
description: Trace long critical sections

preemptoff.description: Find long sections where preemption was off

irqoff.description: Find long sections where IRQ was off

duration.description: Duration in uS (microseconds) below which we filter

name: dbslower-bpfcc
description: Command to trace slow database queries using BPFCC

engine.description: The database engine to use (mysql or postgres)

verbose.description: Print the BPF program

threshold.description: Trace queries slower than this threshold (ms)

name: dbstat-bpfcc
description: Display a histogram of database query latencies

verbose.description: Print the BPF program

threshold.description: Trace queries slower than this threshold (ms)

microseconds.description: Display query latencies in microseconds (default: milliseconds)

name: dcsnoop-bpfcc
description: Trace directory entry cache (dcache) lookups

all.description: Trace all dcache lookups (default is fails only)

name: dcstat-bpfcc
description: Get statistics about the system using BPF Compiler Collection

interval.description: The time interval in seconds between each data collection

count.description: The number of times to collect data

name: deadlock-bpfcc
description: Detect potential deadlocks (lock inversions) in a running binary.

binary.description: If set, trace the mutexes from the binary at this path. For statically-linked binaries, this argument is not required. For dynamically-linked binaries, this argument is required and should be the path of the pthread library the binary is using. Example: /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libpthread.so.0

dump-graph.description: If set, this will dump the mutex graph to the specified file.

verbose.description: Print statistics about the mutex wait graph.

lock-symbols.description: Comma-separated list of lock symbols to trace. Default is pthread_mutex_lock. These symbols cannot be inlined in the binary.

unlock-symbols.description: Comma-separated list of unlock symbols to trace. Default is pthread_mutex_unlock. These symbols cannot be inlined in the binary.

name: drsnoop-bpfcc
description: Trace direct reclaim

duration.description: Total duration of trace in seconds

name.description: Only print process names containing this name

verbose.description: Show system memory state

name: execsnoop-bpfcc
description: Trace exec() syscalls

cgroupmap.description: Trace cgroups in this BPF map only

mntnsmap.description: Trace mount namespaces in this BPF map only

name.description: Only print commands matching this name (regex), any arg

line.description: Only print commands where arg contains this line (regex)

max-args.description: Maximum number of arguments parsed and displayed, defaults to 20

name: exitsnoop-bpfcc
description: Trace all process termination (exit, fatal signal)

name: ext4dist-bpfcc
description: Summarize ext4 operation latency

milliseconds.description: Output in milliseconds

name: ext4slower-bpfcc
description: Trace common ext4 file operations slower than a threshold

name: filelife-bpfcc
description: Trace stat() syscalls

description: Summarize scheduler run queue length as a histogram

cpus.description: Print output for each CPU separately

tid.description: trace this TID only (use for threads only)

description: Trace shm*() syscalls

name.description: Only print process names containing this name

description: Summarize soft irq event time as histograms

name: solisten-bpfcc
description: Stream sockets listen

name: sslsniff-bpfcc
description: Sniff SSL data

hexdump.description: Show data as hexdump instead of trying to decode it as UTF-8.

description: Count events and their stack traces

regexp.description: Use regular expressions. Default is "*" wildcards only.

perpid.description: Display stacks separately for each process

verbose.description: Show raw addresses

description: Trace stat() syscalls

errno.description: Trace only syscalls that return this error (numeric or EPERM, etc.)

process.description: Count by process and not by syscall

list.description: Print list of recognized syscalls and exit

name: tplist-bpfcc
description: Display kernel tracepoints or USDT probes and their formats.

filter.description: A filter that specifies which probes/tracepoints to print

pid.description: List USDT probes in the specified process

lib.description: List USDT probes in the specified library or executable

v.description: Increase verbosity level (print variables, arguments, etc.)

name: trace-bpfcc
description: Attach to functions and print trace messages

buffer_pages.description: number of pages to use for perf_events ring buffer (default: 64)

pid.description: id of the process to trace (optional)

tid.description: id of the thread to trace (optional)

verbose.description: print resulting BPF program code before executing

string_size.description: maximum size to read from strings

include_self.description: do not filter trace's own pid from the trace

max_events.description: number of events to print before quitting

timestamp.description: print timestamp column (offset from trace start)

unix_timestamp.description: print UNIX timestamp instead of offset from trace start, requires -t

name.description: only print process names containing this name

msg_filter.description: only print the msg of event containing this string

bin_cmp.description: allow to use STRCMP with binary values

sym_file_list.description: coma separated list of symbol files to use for symbol resolution

include.description: additional header files to include in the BPF program as either full path, or relative to current working directory, or relative to default kernel header search path

name: ttysnoop-bpfcc
description: Snoop output from a pts or tty device, eg, a shell

device.description: Path to a tty device (eg, /dev/tty0) or pts number

description: Summarize method calls in high-level languages.

interval.description: Print every specified number of seconds

language.description: Language to trace (if none, trace syscalls only)

top.description: Number of most frequent/slow calls to print

latency.description: Record method latency from enter to exit (except recursive calls)

verbose.description: Verbose mode: print the BPF program (for debugging purposes)

milliseconds.description: Report times in milliseconds (default is microseconds)

older.description: Prune allocations younger than this age in milliseconds

command.description: Execute and trace the specified command

wa-missing-free.description: Workaround to alleviate misjudgments when free is missing

sample-rate.description: Sample every N-th allocation to decrease the overhead

min-size.description: Capture only allocations larger than this size

max-size.description: Capture only allocations smaller than this size

obj.description: Attach to allocator functions in the specified object

verbose.description: Verbose mode: print the BPF program (for debugging purposes)

name: rubygc-bpfcc
description: Summarize garbage collection events in high-level languages.

verbose.description: Verbose mode: print the BPF program (for debugging purposes)

milliseconds.description: Report times in milliseconds (default is microseconds)

minimum.description: Display only GCs longer than this many milliseconds

filter.description: Display only GCs whose description contains this text

name: javacalls-bpfcc
description: Summarize method calls in high-level languages.

interval.description: Print every specified number of seconds

language.description: Language to trace (if none, trace syscalls only)

top.description: Number of most frequent/slow calls to print

latency.description: Record method latency from enter to exit (except recursive calls)

verbose.description: Verbose mode: print the BPF program (for debugging purposes)

milliseconds.description: Report times in milliseconds (default is microseconds)

name: javagc-bpfcc
description: Summarize garbage collection events in high-level languages.

verbose.description: Verbose mode: print the BPF program (for debugging purposes)

milliseconds.description: Report times in milliseconds (default is microseconds)

minimum.description: Display only GCs longer than this many milliseconds

filter.description: Display only GCs whose description contains this text

name: pythoncalls-bpfcc
description: Summarize method calls in high-level languages.

interval.description: Print every specified number of seconds

language.description: Language to trace (if none, trace syscalls only)

top.description: Number of most frequent/slow calls to print

latency.description: Record method latency from enter to exit (except recursive calls)

verbose.description: Verbose mode: print the BPF program (for debugging purposes)

milliseconds.description: Report times in milliseconds (default is microseconds)
